availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Abel Newbrough (Hopkins County Boot and Shoe maker)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, shoe/boot maker. Virginia native. Married to Susan Newbrough. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Shoe/boot maker in Hopkins County in 1860. Received Patent No. 49,138 for a churn in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 248.
Annual Report of the Commissioner of patents for the Year 1865, vol. 2 (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1867), 591.
Find A Grave, "Abel Newbraugh (1800-October 2, 1879)," Memorial #66895698, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66895698 (accessed March 22, 2017).
